etymology.description: Depicts a wine vessel; originally with 土 (tǔ, "earth") component on bronze inscriptions -> corrupted to 仌 (bīng, "ice") in small seal script
etymology.interpretation: The character 卣(yǒu) represents a type of wine vessel, depicted as a container. Over time, its component 土(tǔ) was replaced by 仌(bīng), possibly due to misinterpretation or evolution in script styles.

examples.chinese: 古代祭祀时(古代祭祀時)，卣常被用来储酒(卣常被用來儲酒)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài jìsì shí, yǒu cháng bèi yòng lái chǔ jiǔ.
examples.english: During ancient sacrificial ceremonies, wine vessels were commonly used to store wine.

examples.chinese: 博物馆里(博物館裡)，陈列着青铜卣(陳列著青銅卣)，供游客观赏(供遊客觀賞)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn lǐ, chén liè zhe qīngtóng yǒu, gòng yóukè guānshǎng.
examples.english: In the museum, bronze wine vessels are displayed for visitors to admire.

examples.chinese: 卣是古代的酒器(卣是古代的酒器)。
examples.english: The wine vessel is an ancient drinking vessel.
